Comments_List: Learning more about the way math actually works
Basic calculus of one variable.  Helped me develop and maintain skills in logical thinking and quantitative reasoning.
I learned how to problem solve in a different way. Though I took calculus in high school, I learned to approach topics I had already learned to ensure a deeper understanding of each.
there could be more office hours held and more sessions on how to do the problem sets - specifically giving out the answers to problem sets prior to exams

Strengths- good teaching
Weaknesses- lots of unnecessary work
this course does not explain differential equations well- don't act like it's confusing it makes sense when it's explained right.

I thought it was well taught. It would be useful to go over more challenging examples in class, similar to problem set and WebAssign questions. I also thought it was difficult to have the WebAssigns due on days we did not have class. I would rather have them due on a day we had class for book keeping purposes.
yes, it gives you a good basis
I did not particularly enjoy the course but I think that it is very useful. For this reason, I would most probably recommend it to someone who thinks they will need to use Math in the future.
I would recommend to a student that needs to take it for distributional requirements.
Yes, it is necessary math. It was a well structured calculus course.
